text:
Twelfth Avenue, west side, north from W.50th Street, showing the piers lining the waterfront. View 1 is at 50th Street and view 2 north from 53rd Street. Piles of gravel are shown on the left.

P.L.Sperr

View 1: April 14, 1931
View 2: March 20, 1927

Twelfth Avenue, west side, north from W.50th Street, showing the piers lining the waterfront. View 1 is at 50th Street and view 2 north from 53rd Street. Piles of gravel are shown on the left.

P.L.Sperr

View 1: April 14, 1931
View 2: March 20, 1927

Twelfth Avenue, east side, at West 50th Street, showing a lunch wagon at the S. E. corner. This is detailed in View 2.

September 26, 1928
June 30, 1930

P. L. Sperr

Twelfth Avenue, east side, at West 50th Street, showing a lunch wagon at the S. E. corner. This is detailed in View 2.

September 26, 1928
June 30, 1930

P. L. Sperr

Twelfth Avenue, at the N.E. corner of West 50th Street, Also shown is West 50th Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Twelfth Avenue. View 2 shows the same area from a different angle, at an earlier date.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: May 11, 1935
View 2: June 30, 1930

Twelfth Avenue, at the N.E. corner of West 50th Street, Also shown is West 50th Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Twelfth Avenue. View 2 shows the same area from a different angle, at an earlier date.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: May 11, 1935
View 2: June 30, 1930

North (Hudson) River, showing piers 89 (partially obscured by barges) and 90, off Twelfth Ave., at the foot of West 49th and 50th Streets, respectively. These piers were later demolished and on the site of pier 90 was constructed (between 1931 and 1934) a new 1000 foot dock to accommodate large ocean liners (Pier 89 was not rebuilt).

April 10, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: North (Hudson) River - Piers 89-91.

text:
North (Hudson) River, showing piers 91 and 90, off Twelfth Ave., at the foot of West 51st and 50th Streets, respectively. The view is in a southeasterly direction from pier 92 (foot of West 52nd Street).

July 12, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: North (Hudson) River - Piers 90-91.

text:
Twelfth Avenue, east side, north from West 50th Street. showing the new frontage of this thoroughfare after a slice was removed from this side. The building with the sign " Rims - Wheels" faces on the north side of 51st Street. The small cottage is No. 634 West 52nd Street.

April 15, 1934
March 26, 1935

P. L. Sperr

Twelfth Avenue, east side, north from West 50th Street. showing the new frontage of this thoroughfare after a slice was removed from this side. The building with the sign " Rims - Wheels" faces on the north side of 51st Street. The small cottage is No. 634 West 52nd Street.

April 15, 1934
March 26, 1935

P. L. Sperr

(1)
North (Hudson) River, showing piers 92 (not covered) and 90 (steel frame), off Twelfth Ave., at the foot of West 52nd and West 50th Streets, respectively. The view is a southeasterly direction from pier 93, at the foot of West 53rd Street.
May 8, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Another view of pier 92 right, and part of pier 93 (left).
May 8, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
An exclusive view of pier 92, at a later date, showing construction of the frame superstructure upon its base seen in views 1 and 2.
September 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
title: North (Hudson) River - Piers 90-92.
